      • onCameraTorchSupportStatusAvailable

        protected void onCameraTorchSupportStatusAvailable(boolean cameraTorchSupported)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController

        Specified by:
        onCameraTorchSupportStatusAvailable in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        cameraTorchSupported - whether active camera supports torch(flashlight) or not.

      • createDocumentStepCameraOverlay

        @NonNull
protected android.view.View createDocumentStepCameraOverlay()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Creates and returns camera overlay view for the document verification step. This is appropriate place where references to all camera overlay subviews, that must be available later, should be obtained.
        Specified by:
        createDocumentStepCameraOverlay in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Returns:
        created camera overlay view.

      • onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached

        public void onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached(@NonNull
                                               RecognizerRunnerFragment recognizerRunnerFragment,
                                               @NonNull
                                               android.app.Activity activity)
        Description copied from interface: ScanningOverlay
        Called after RecognizerRunnerFragment gets attached to its host activity. This happens before RecognizerRunnerFragment.onCreateView(LayoutInflater, ViewGroup, Bundle) which internally invokes ScanningOverlay.onRecognizerRunnerViewCreated(RecognizerRunnerFragment). This means that at the time this method is invoked, methods like RecognizerRunnerFragment.getRecognizerRunnerView() or RecognizerRunnerFragment.getContentLayout() will return null. However, this is a good place to register your LifecycleObserver with RecognizerRunnerFragment.registerLifecycleObserver(LifecycleObserver) if your overlay needs to be notified about lifecycle events of RecognizerRunnerFragment.
        Specified by:
        onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached in interface ScanningOverlay
        Overrides:
        onRecognizerRunnerFragmentAttached in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        recognizerRunnerFragment - RecognizerRunnerFragment that has been attached to host activity.
        activity - Activity to which RecognizerRunnerFragment has been attached.

      • onStartDocumentFirstSide

        protected void onStartDocumentFirstSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan first side and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Specified by:
        onStartDocumentFirstSide in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onStartDocumentSecondSide

        protected void onStartDocumentSecondSide(boolean isCameraPreviewStarted)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback method that is called when document recognizer is set to scan second side (only if second side exists) and recognition is started. This method is called after the document step camera overlay has been created. This is appropriate place to make appropriate UI changes, e.g. show messages about started step/side, show splash screen, etc.
        Specified by:
        onStartDocumentSecondSide in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        isCameraPreviewStarted - whether camera preview has been already started or not. If the camera preview has not been started yet (value is false), method BaseCameraEventsListener.onCameraPreviewStarted() will be called when/if the camera is successfully started.

      • onGlare

        public void onGlare(boolean glareDetected)
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Callback that is called during recognition process when/if the glare is detected on the scanned document. This is appropriate place to perform UI updates and inform user that glare is detected (or that glare is not present any more).
        Specified by:
        onGlare in interface GlareCallback
        Specified by:
        onGlare in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Parameters:
        glareDetected - whether glare is detected or not.

      • createAdditionalStepConfiguration

        @Nullable
protected BaseVerificationOverlayController.AdditionalStepConfiguration createAdditionalStepConfiguration()
        Description copied from class: BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Creates configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step.
        Specified by:
        createAdditionalStepConfiguration in class BaseVerificationOverlayController
        Returns:
        configuration for the additional verification step that can be performed in the verification flow in addition to the document recognizer step, or null if the additional verification step is not needed. In that case additional step will not be performed.

      • setTorchButton

        @AnyThread
protected final void setTorchButton(@Nullable
                                               android.widget.ImageView torchButton)

      • setTorchStateListener

        public void setTorchStateListener(@Nullable
                                  OverlayTorchStateListener torchStateListener)
        Sets torch state listener that will be notified on every torch status change. Also it receives notifications about torch support status when camera preview is started.
        Parameters:
        torchStateListener - listener that will receive notifications, or null to remove existing listener.

      • setShowButtons

        public void setShowButtons(boolean showTopButtons)
        Sets whether the torch nad back buttons will be shown and available to user for changing the torch state and exiting the activity. When overlay does not control the torch state (e.g. when host activity has torch button), torch button which is shown inside overlay should be hidden by using this method. In that case torch state can be updated programmatically by using BlinkCardOverlayController.setTorchState(boolean) method.
        Parameters:
        showTopButtons - true to show torch and back buttons, false to hide it

      • setTorchState

        public void setTorchState(boolean torchOn)
        Turns the torch on or off. If torch update is not yet available (e.g. camera is not started yet) does nothing.
        Parameters:
        torchOn - true to turn the torch on, false to turn it off.
